author: m5x
body:
# PR Summary

Allow `System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.Command` operating in `IsScript = true` mode to remember and pass on path to the script file and make use of this feature when executing script file passed as -File command line argument.

## PR Context

Fixes #4217

comments.author: m5x
comments.body: Tests have been added. I also added one small change to use `ExternalScriptInfo` for scripts with known path (i.e. scripts started with -File argument) and thus provide proper values in $MyInvocation special variable even for scripts without .ps1 extension.

comments.author: m5x
comments.body: Sorry for the spacing around parentheses. I like to put spaces inside for better readability and I've been doing it so long that I type it automatically this way and sometimes forget to check and fix it when committing to other projects. I will fix it in next commit - should I add [Feature] prefix to the commit message again to comply with  [testing guidelines](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/testing-guidelines.md#requesting-additional-tests-for-a-pr) in case it is the last one of this PR?
